channel.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
channel.description:
Alright, im God Father, im new to moparscape forums but been playing runescape privates for some time now.. i've gotten all the items needed to make the runescape private server such as (JDK, no-ip DUC, A server(source/client) and port forwarding) all of that has been done.
Now my problem is that how do i actually start up the server? from where i got stuck is i was supposed to go the EGUI.java or GUI.java in the client folder and change the ip to my server ip.. but some servers that i've downloaded here on moparscape, i could not locate those two files (GUI,EGUI) and continuously kept downloading other servers to see if they have it.. and when i did find it i changed the ip of what i was told in a video, but then i could not locate to run the source, and i could not run the client without the source being online..
i've searched everywhere in the forums but all it seems to shwo is how to do the main things for a server (JDK,no-ip DUC,downloading a server).. but none show how do change the client server to mine.. and then starting it up completely.
Please i need help, i've come so far learning how to do this and i don't want to be stuck here for a simple thing that i can be helped with.

item.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

Commands.java for project insanity, client.java for delta.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others

item.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
item.dc:creator: @God_Father God Father
item.description:
@God_Father wrote:

Devinhdl:

just close the server out and if it logs you out, then it was yours lol

Thank youu! it works!!! i’ve made my self owner, now i just gotta find out what all the commands are…

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others

item.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

God Father:

alright can you check if this works? godfather.no-ip.biz im in the server i just want to know if im in my server, not someone elses

Check if your in your server what do you mean? Get on local host look at your server, then try your no-ip if its the same then its your server…

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:2, topic:426425”][Client Sided]If you can’t find EGUI or Gui, open up client.java and search for [quote]server =[/quote] change that ip to your local host ip(127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0)
but if you can find EGUI or Gui, change the ips in there to the local host and change the ip in client.java

you don’t have to change anything ip wise on the server side(usually)[/quote]
You never have to change ips server sided? And if he wants to acctually get his server public he needs no ip otherwise he can just use 127.0.0.1

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others

item.title: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

[Client Sided]If you can’t find EGUI or Gui, open up client.java and search for

server =
change that ip to your local host ip(127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0)
but if you can find EGUI or Gui, change the ips in there to the local host and change the ip in client.java

you don’t have to change anything ip wise on the server side(usually)

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help Actually Starting Up The Server For Yourself, and Others

Alright, im God Father, im new to moparscape forums but been playing runescape privates for some time now… i’ve gotten all the items needed to make the runescape private server such as (JDK, no-ip DUC, A server(source/client) and port forwarding) all of that has been done.
